data.title: Fixed warning.
data.body:
Sort struct initialization to match fields declaration avoids a warnings on GCC.

This is a bit tricky, because with this little change I had removed a good amount of warnings, console.h were included almost anywhere.
I have run some demo and all seem to work fine.

data.title: Project generator VS2012 Optimized Debug non-compilation
data.body: Using the present Project generation configuration to batch build a release, debug and optimized debug trio, OptimizedDebug (symbols, but no additional flags flipped on for in-depth tests) fails due to the inability to find xAudio.

data.title: Remove demo and trial checks
data.body: Removing stuff pertaining to demo modes and trials, as they're pointless.

data.title: Crash caused by saving lighting variables as prefs
data.body: See [this thread](http://forums.torque3d.org/viewtopic.php?f=10&t=279) for details.

data.title: Bullet BtWorld crash
data.body:
Happening when loading outpost, bullet physics.

i suspect the polysoup after Azaezel contributed to investigate the issue further down 
with me, we were able to load outpost mission after deleting the mesh road.

prior to that, several items were removed to no effect. another crash happened when
i was visiting the static buildings.

i do suspect some part of the code is getting NaN numbers at the convex sweeps passes
i do not know how to label this, but its a Bug / crash that need fixing, it is happening only
in debug mode if that can help, something is deactivated in release that does not trigger
this crash.

data.title: Fixed some minor compiler warnings on Linux
data.body:
I am building this project on linux, gcc version 4.9.2 (Ubuntu 4.9.2-10ubuntu13), and I was shocked to get more than 20.000 compiler warnings. So I just started to clean some of them.

I plan to add more compiler warning clean commits if this little commits are accepted and merged.

data.title: OpenGL only rendering the canvas clear color for 3.7 Release
data.body:
Latest 3.7 releases from the wiki and github have broken OpenGL 
on AMD Radeon HD 7700 + Win 8.1
- **The 3.7 development branch pulled on 6.27.2015 works fine.**
- The 3.7 Master branch displays broken behavior on this system

Win 8.1
AMD Radeon HD 7700 
AMD FX(tm)-6350 Six-Core Processor, 3900 Mhz, 3 Core(s), 6 Logical Processor(s)
Direct3D Version    9.14.10.01080
OpenGL Version  6.14.10.13283

Console log: https://www.dropbox.com/s/12ualthdsyzmfjd/console.log?dl=0
Issue seems to start at:
_“OPENGL: glUniform3fv has failed because the operation requires a currently active program object (GL_INVALID_OPERATION)”_
- OpenGL only displays the canvas clear color in the editor
- Only working Debug Render is Bounding Boxes
- Tested with Empty Room, Empty Terrain and Outpost
- Behavior is the same for projects from the wiki files **Torque3D-3.7.zip**, **Torque3D-3.7-Win.zip** and  github **Torque3D-master.zip** pulled on 6.26 and 6.27
- The 3.7 development branch pulled on 6.27.2015 works fine.

OpenGL works well on this system with:
- Previous 3.7 dev and “release” pulled from Github on 5.29.15 
- Previous releases, e.g. 3.63, Azaezel's PBR branch etc. 

**Examples**
![torqueogl1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7356383/8393281/69e07dbc-1cd7-11e5-8bc4-2a4a48b7f98f.png)

![torqueogl2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7356383/8393283/74f39ec8-1cd7-11e5-92fd-a27406e9cbb2.png)

![torqueogl3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7356383/8393285/79416e2e-1cd7-11e5-94a7-8d7533725e0a.png)

data.title: Plugging Memory Leaks
data.body: There's a few more here and there I'll want to get to as soon as I can, but better to have a couple to start with than none.

data.title: initial aspect ratio maintaining relative gui scaling
data.body: adds 3 new horizontal relative gui entries for dealing with swapping elements between 4:3 and 16:9 aspect ratios.  "relativeToYL" maintains the initial aspect ratio, keeping the leftmost edge the same, "relativeToYR" also shifts it so the right hand side is shifted over so that edge would match, and "relativeToYC" takes/adds space from both sides

data.title: 64bit Visual Studio Projects
data.body: This converts the Visual Studio projects generated by the Project Manager to default as 64 bit.

data.title: Basic fix for stereo rendering without a display device
data.body: Fixes stereo rendering when a display device isn't present, reproducing similar behaviour to before the Oculus DK2 changes.

data.title: Compiling with OpenGL need Directx_SDK dependence
data.body:
Why T3D need DirectX_SDK dependence if I was compiling with OpenGL?
The requirement for DirectX_SDK should be removed when is compiling with OpenGL. Or I'm wrong?

VS2010
release-3.7 branch

data.title: Release 3.7

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
Ok i stuffed up the other PR, branch was a mess. Anyways...attempt number 2 :)

This took ages to track down, compiling on VS 2013 was displaying nothing but the clear screen color when loading a level with GL. Long story short, the materials where not able to set their shader because the GFXGLDevice setShader function was wrong (missing the bool force).

data.body:
Hi Guys,

This took ages to track down, compiling on VS 2013 was displaying nothing but the clear screen color when loading a level with GL. Long story short, the materials where not able to set their shader. Code changes should explain it anyway.

data.body: Fixed a issue with the terrain blending having hard-edges.

data.title: Replace uses of dStrCmp  with new String::compare
data.body:
Moves from using dStrCmp to the new String::compare static functions keeps things cleaner, consistent, and works with intellisense.

This is the part of the move to replace usage of the old dStr___ functions for the more standard String namespace approach.

data.title: Replace uses of dStrIsEmpty with new String::isEmpty
data.body:
Moves from using dStrIsEmpty to the new String::isEmpty static function. Keeps things cleaner, consistent, and works with intellisense.

This is the first move to replace usage of the old dStr___ functions for the more standard String namespace approach.

data.title: No need for server-only aps to generate visible textures.
Nonocculus popup dialog fix
data.body: With the updated oculus stuff, there was a issue introduced that was making popups not work in non-oculus builds. This fixes it.

data.title: OpenGl Terrain blend seams
data.body:
Terrain texture seams at blend edges with 2+  texture layers, only in OpenGl.

Occurs when using any detail texture and seems independent of square size, resolutions, base texture size etc.

Only tested on AMD Radeon HD7700 + updated drivers.
Win 8.1
Tested with Torque v3.6.3 and  3.7 Release

Solution / workaround  
 In game\shaders\common\terrain\terrain.glsl
**uv += 0.00195;**
vec2 xy = floor( uv );

Forum post:http://forums.torque3d.org/viewtopic.php?f=9&t=231

![seam4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7356383/7888730/9f176602-0608-11e5-9762-6eca6d8d2f3f.png)
![seam2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7356383/7888738/adf5ef54-0608-11e5-8728-f72be232fc97.png)

![seam3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7356383/7888736/a7c37d5e-0608-11e5-8b44-66310f7460af.png)

data.title: Editor crashes after lighting change
data.body:
I get a lot of crashes when using the editor with the newest branch, it crashes when you switch to the editor and back to the game again after you changed some stuff in the editor and it crashes if you press F11 again in the editor and sometimes it crashes when you want to exit.

There is always the following lines at the end of the console log:

Win32Window::WindowProc - resetting device due to window size change.
GFXPCD3D9Device::reset - depthstencil 123f3af8 has 3 ref's

data.title: Flickering with colors blue,red and green. Shape editor.
data.body:
t3d 3.7rc

1)
- Activate "Show Nodes"
- Activate "Wireframe"

Began an oddish flickering with colors blue,red and green. Sorry but can't take a pic, for some reason the screenshot don't show the bug.

2)
- Activate "Show Nodes"
- Activate "Shape transparency"
  ![shapeeditor1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1057449/7669077/ee18b668-fc24-11e4-8f75-35c14e05309b.JPG)
